qr_code#

1. join_directories#

qr_code.join_directories(*paths)#

A helper function to generate the absolute path and joining multiple paths together.

Parameters

paths (args of strings) – args of strings of path.

Returns

return absolute path in string

Return type

string

2. generate_hash_key#

qr_code.generate_hash_key(row, features_selected)#

To generate a hash key as a primary key for the entries of the samples in our DB.

Parameters

  • row (int or 200) – Status code to return to frontend.

  • features_selected (list) – a list that is [‘experiment_id’, ‘storage_condition’, ‘analyst’,’contents’,’date_entered’,’expiration_date’]

Returns

qr_code_key : Returns generated hashed qr_code_key

Return type

str

3. test_fit_using_ttf_font#

qr_code.test_fit_using_ttf_font(font_size, string, font_filename, available_width)#

Adjust font size to fit available white space instead of overlapping the qr code.

Parameters

  • font_size (str) – font size that we choose to use.

  • string (str) – String that we want to print onto the label.

  • font_file (str) – name of the font file.

  • available_width (str) – width for adjusting text.

Returns

font: The updated ttf font.

Return type

ImageFont.truetype

Returns

font_size: size of the font.

Return type

int

4. anchor_adjustment#

qr_code.anchor_adjustment(desired_location, string, font)#

Adjust text location using middle bottom to text location using left upper.

Parameters

  • desired_location (str) – The text location using middle bottom part of text.

  • string (str) – The text that will be used to be placed onto the label.

  • font (ImageFont.truetype) – ttf font object

Returns

left_location

Return type

str

5. small_format#

qr_code.small_format(qr_img, obj, font_filename, background_filename)#

Accept the qr code image and info from obj to generate a label suitable for 2ml and 2.5 ml vile

Parameters

  • qr_img (img) – qr code generated in create_qr_code function.

  • obj (dic) – Info contains columns in feature_selected.

  • font_filename (str) – The name of the fontfile.

  • background_filename (str) – The name of the background filename.

Returns

img: a designed label image with text and qr code.

Return type

ImageFont.truetype

6. large_format#

qr_code.large_format(qr_img, obj, font_filename, background_filename)#

Accept the qr code image and info from obj to generate a label suitable for 4ml and 10 ml vile

Parameters

  • qr_img (img) – qr code generated in create_qr_code function.

  • obj (dic) – Info contains columns in feature_selected.

  • font_filename (str) – The name of the fontfile.

  • background_filename (str) – The name of the background filename.

Returns

img: a designed label image with text and qr code.

Return type

ImageFont.truetype

7. create_qr_code#

qr_code.create_qr_code(obj)#

Creates a unique qr_code_key using arguments from obj, then uses qrcode library to generate a QR code containing the date and the qr_code key

Parameters

obj (dic) – Dictionary with key value pairs of the fields of the sample: (experiment_id ,storage_condition, analyst, expiration_date, date_entered, contents)

Returns

hash : Unique qr_code_key hash that is generated.

Return type

str
